intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion larsii-levii, commonly known as the Levantine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. It has basal leaves that are generally heart-shaped or triangular with serrated edges. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn.
